img.alt: Faith Guritz - Associated Press Division 4 Girls Basketball All-State Team

div.h2: Faith Guritz - Associated Press Division 4 Girls Basketball All-State Team

div.p: Faith led a 22-1 Martin team by averaging 12.5 points, 6.9 rebounds, 2.8 steals, 1.6 assists and 0.7 blocks per game. She also reached the 1,000-point milestone this year and finished her career with 1,131 points.

PreK-6th Grade Continuity of Learning Plan
Martin Public Schools Continuity of Learning and COVID-19 Response Plan

hr.p: Please see Superintendent Brooke Ballee-Stone's letter regarding Governor Whitmer's Executive Order 2020-35, effectively closing all Michigan school districts for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year.

As we prepare for the extended distance learning it is necessary to gather some additional information to better support our Martin families. Please take a moment to complete the following 6 survey questions. This will help us to know how our families are and what your capabilities are for extended learning. If you have already completed this survey via the Martin Public Schools Facebook page, please disregard this message. Thank you SO much in advance!

h1.a: Board of Education Committee Meeting - April 27, 2020
March 13th ACHD Flattening the Curve COVID19
Letter from Allegan County Health Department
Martin Board of Education Meeting Schedule 2019/2020

p.span: NOW HIRING & TRAINING SCHOOL BUS DRIVERS

METS - Michigan Educational Transportation Services is hiring school bus drivers and new trainees for assignment at Martin Public Schools. No experience is necessary. Paid training is provided for qualified candidates who enjoy working with children, have a safe driving record and are able to pass DOT physical & drug testing requirements. Competitive wages ($17.00 per hour substitute, $18.00 per hour daily route), paid time off (personal days & holidays), attendance incentives and 401k retirement savings options are available. Find out how to qualify for a $500 sign-on bonus!

p.strong: Please consider making a donation to the Martin Education Foundation. The foundation is a not-for-profit organization that provides scholarships and grants to Martin students and staff. Please see the attached brochure.

hr.p: Our band program is in need of used band instruments. If you have one or know someone who has an instrument that is no longer wanted, we could put it to good use. Your donation is tax deductible, and we will provide a receipt. Thanks in advanced for your generosity.
